Calculations

Class Calculations

  • java.lang.Object
    • Calculations.Calculations

  • public class Calculations
extends java.lang.Object
    Used for calculating the distance, time, and angle of the planet/star.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Calculations(java.lang.Double planetMass, java.lang.Double angMomentum)
      Initialize values for calculating the distance between two celestial body Mass of the star is initialized as 333054.25*(Mass of Earth)--Mass of the sun
      Calculations(java.lang.Double starMass, java.lang.Double planetMass, java.lang.Double angMomentum)
      Initialize values for calculating the distance between two celestial body Mass of the star can be initialized in this constructor

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Double distance()
      Calculates the distance between the star and the planet
      java.lang.Double f(java.lang.Double x)
      Derivative of the function to be considered for the secant method
      java.lang.Double g(java.lang.Double x)
      Function to be considered for secant method
      java.lang.Double getDistance()
      Accessor function for the distance lowered by a factor of 10^9
      java.lang.Double secant(int n, java.lang.Double del, java.lang.Double x, java.lang.Double dx)
      Secant method to approximate the root of a function of a specific value
      java.lang.Double theta(java.lang.Double t)
      Calculates the angle of the planet at a specific time
      java.lang.Double time()
      Calculates the time it takes for a planet to make a full revolution

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Calculations

        public Calculations(java.lang.Double planetMass,
                    java.lang.Double angMomentum)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialize values for calculating the distance between two celestial body Mass of the star is initialized as 333054.25*(Mass of Earth)--Mass of the sun
        Parameters:
        planetMass - mass of the planet to use in the calculation must be a factor of Earth's mass
        angMomentum - angular momentum of the planet
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown when planetMass is 0 or less

      • Calculations

        public Calculations(java.lang.Double starMass,
                    java.lang.Double planetMass,
                    java.lang.Double angMomentum)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Initialize values for calculating the distance between two celestial body Mass of the star can be initialized in this constructor
        Parameters:
        starMass - mass of the star to be considered for calculation--must be a factor of Earth's mass
        planetMass - mass of the planet to use in the calculation--must be a factor of Earth's mass
        angMomentum - angular momentum of the planet
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when planet or star mass is 0 or less

    • Method Detail

      • distance

        public java.lang.Double distance()
        Calculates the distance between the star and the planet
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the distance

      • getDistance

        public java.lang.Double getDistance()
        Accessor function for the distance lowered by a factor of 10^9
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the distance

      • secant

        public java.lang.Double secant(int n,
                               java.lang.Double del,
                               java.lang.Double x,
                               java.lang.Double dx)
        Secant method to approximate the root of a function of a specific value
        Parameters:
        n - number of data points to consider
        del - accepted error
        x - first guess
        dx - change in x
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the root

      • g

        public java.lang.Double g(java.lang.Double x)
        Function to be considered for secant method
        Parameters:
        x - a guess for the root
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the value of the function at the specified x

      • f

        public java.lang.Double f(java.lang.Double x)
        Derivative of the function to be considered for the secant method
        Parameters:
        x - a guess for the root
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the first derivative value at the specified x

      • time

        public java.lang.Double time()
        Calculates the time it takes for a planet to make a full revolution
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the time it takes to make a complete revolution

      • theta

        public java.lang.Double theta(java.lang.Double t)
        Calculates the angle of the planet at a specific time
        Parameters:
        t - specific time to be considered to angle calculation
        Returns:
        a Double indicating the angle
